adjectives.description: factorial (comparative more factorial, superlative most factorial)

entries.meaning: (mathematics) Of or pertaining to a factor or factorial.
Of or pertaining to a factor, a kind of business agent.
examples: The latter sold the goods to a customer who was cashier to certain creditors of the agents without disclosing the factorial capacity in which they acted.

entries.meaning: (dated) Of or pertaining to a factory.

(mathematics, combinatorics) The result of multiplying a given number of consecutive integers from 1 to the given number. In equations, it is symbolized by an exclamation mark (!). For example, 5! = 1 × 2 × 3 × 4 × 5 = 120.
